org.robolectric.util

Class FragmentController<F extends android.app.Fragment>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.robolectric.util.ComponentController<FragmentController<F>,F>
      • org.robolectric.util.FragmentController<F>

  • public class FragmentController<F extends android.app.Fragment>
extends ComponentController<FragmentController<F>,F>
    Controller class for driving fragment lifecycles, similar to ActivityController. Only necessary if more complex lifecycle management is needed, otherwise FragmentTestUtil should be sufficient.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.robolectric.util.ComponentController

        attached, component, intent, myself, shadowMainLooper

      • create

        public FragmentController<F> create(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Creates the activity with Bundle and adds the fragment to it. Note that the fragment will be added to the view with ID 1.
